instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-0138: What is 820-0138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this lineâ€™s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High Fans
threads.message:
Hi, I have a liquid damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with hi fans. The damage is minor and directly was found on <RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR>. <SIGNAL>G3_POWERON_L</SIGNAL> pad was burnt off the board as well. i have so far ran a wire from <SIGNAL>G3_POWERON_L</SIGNAL> to its test point next to <RESISTOR>R5172</RESISTOR>. <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL</SIGNAL> is fluctuating from 3.42 - 3.20V. Replaced <RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR> and reballed the original SMC and ISL. Diode mode on SMBUS is .510 and Diode on <SIGNAL>G3_POWERON_L</SIGNAL> is .728. Fans are still high with no other signs of liquid. Should I try another SMC? Any advice would be appreciated.

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High Fans
threads.message:
Try known good trackpad and flex first.
SCL/SDA linees of battery bus should measure less than 1% difference to ground, on diode mode.
If battery is recognized and charging, that bus is OK.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High Fans
threads.message: Will do, and thanks for the explanation.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High Fans
threads.message:
Just got new trackpad and flex in. No difference. Fans still high and system runs poorly. 

Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High Fans
threads.message: Do you have an oscilloscope to check if there is some activity on SDA and SCL lines????

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High Fans
threads.message: Install some software which shows the temps from the board...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High Fans
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High Fans
threads.message:
Thanks.

<TRANSISTOR>Q5410</TRANSISTOR>

Pin 1 - 0
Pin 2 - 3.323V
Pin 3 -17.04V
Pin 4 -17.06V
Pin 5 - 0.003V
Pin 6 -0.003V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High Fans
threads.message:
Pin 5 should be aprox 8.5V; hoewever, pin 3 is correct.
Post <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL> value.
Check for corrosion on that trace...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High Fans
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High Fans
threads.message: Customer suddenly decided not to repair this one after all. Thanks again.
